did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Ben J. McKinney Oral Interview Conducted by Bernard L. Fontana, 1963 February 9 1963
did.abstract: Ben J. McKinney, born in 1883, was a Pioneer cattleman who owned and operated the Ventana Ranch on the Tohono O'Odham Indian Reservation from 1919 to the early 1930's. Interview covers events, personalities, pioneer life and family enterprises. This collection contains a typescript (carbon) of tape recording.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: University of Arizona Libraries, Special Collections

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pioneer cattleman who owned and operated the Ventana Ranch on the Tohono O'Odham Indian Reservation from 1919 to the early 1930's.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Typescript (carbon) of tape recording. Interview covers events, personalities, pioneer life and family enterprises.
At the home of Dorothy McNamee, Tucson, Ariz., February 9, 1963.
